#x should be a tabular data
my_function<-function(x, reps=2){
  for (i in 1:reps){
    print(x)
    
  }
  for (i in 1:nrow(x)){
    print(x[i,])
  }

toy fxn that works
```{r}
#x should be tabular data
#my_function here rewrites the my_function above
my_function<-function(x, condition){
  library(tidyverse)
  x<-x %>% filter(value %in% condition) #filter for the value in the value column of the data frame created above
  return(x) #is returning x
}
```

Calling my_function
```{r}
df<-data.frame(rowid=1:5, value=c("a","b","c","d","e"))

my_function(df) #default value of reps used; gives an error b/c no default for condition
my_function(df, condition = c("c", "e"))

new_df<-my_function(df, condition = c("c", "e"), variable = "value")
new_df
```
